articles.title: Congratulations to Malian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Malian President
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Aug. 17 sent a congratulatory message to Ibrahim Boubacar Keita on the latter's election as president of Mali.
					Kim in his message sincerely wished the Malian president success in his responsible job for the stability and economic development of the country and the wellbeing of the people.
					
					He expressed the belief that the long-standing bilateral ties of friendship and cooperation would steadily grow.

articles.title: Beninese President Meets DPRK Government Delegation
articles.content:
Beninese President Meets DPRK Government Delegation
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Thomas Boni Yayi, president of Benin, met and had a friendly talk with the visiting DPRK government delegation led by its Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun in the presidential palace on August 16.
					He said that the Beninese people would always remember President Kim Il Sung, who extended disinterested aid and cooperation to Benin for its socio-economic development.
					
					The relations between Benin and the DPRK are excellent ones of friendship and cooperation with a long history and tradition, he said, expressing the will to further tighten the ties with the Korean people and boost the cooperation in different fields on the principle of mutual benefits.
					
					Present there were the Beninese minister of Foreign Affairs, African Integration, Francophone Countries and Overseas Compatriots, the advisor to the President on Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned and the DPRK ambassador to Benin.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets His Beninese Counterpart
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets His Beninese Counterpart
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Talks took place between Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, and Nassirou Arifari Bako, minister of Foreign Affairs, African Integration, Francophone Countries and Overseas Compatriots, in Cotonou on Aug. 16.
					Present at the talks from the DPRK side were members of the visiting DPRK government delegation and its ambassador to Benin and from the Beninese side were the director of the department for Asian Affairs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, African Integration, Francophone Countries and Overseas Compatriots. 
					
					At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation in their countries and exchanged views on the issue of developing the bilateral relations and matters of common concern.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Arrives in DR Congo
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Arrives in DR Congo
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government delegation led by Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun arrived in Kinshasa on Saturday to visit the Democratic Republic of Congo. 
					The delegation was greeted at the airport by the acting minister of Foreign Affairs, Cooperation and Francophone Affairs, officials concerned and the DPRK ambassador to DR Congo. 
					
					The delegation left Cotonou by air after winding up its visit to Benin on the same day.

articles.title: Reception Given by Indonesian Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Indonesian Ambassador
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception on Monday on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of the independence of Indonesia.
					Present there on invitation were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of foreign countries and members of international organizations missions here.
					
					Staff members of the Indonesian embassy were on hand.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Kim Po Hyon
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Kim Po Hyon
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were placed before the grave of ardent patriot Kim Po Hyon, grandfather of President Kim Il Sung, in Mangyongdae on Monday on the occasion of the 142nd anniversary of his birth.
					Seen standing before the grave was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					Present at a wreath-laying ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, Ro Tu Chol, and officials of the party and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions and Pyongyangites.
					
					Also placed before it was a wreath in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					Laid before it were wreaths in the names of working people's bodies, ministries and national institutions, educational and media institutions, party and power organs and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Po Hyon who helped his families embark upon the road of revolution with ardent patriotism and noble traits and devoted his all to the country and its people.

articles.title: 3rd Rason Int'l Trade Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
3rd Rason Int'l Trade Exhibition Opens
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The 3rd Rason International Trade Exhibition opened with a due ceremony in Rason City Monday.
					The participants in the opening ceremony placed a floral basket before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il displayed in the Rason Exhibition Hall and paid tribute to them.
					
					Attending the ceremony were Jo Jong Ho, chairman of the organizing committee of the exhibition who is also chairman of the city people's committee, officials concerned, officials in the city, and representatives of foreign countries and regions, those who displayed products in the exhibition and foreign businessmen active in the Rason economic trade zone.
					
					An opening address was made at the ceremony. Then followed congratulatory speeches.
					
					The speakers noted that the DPRK is pushing ahead with economic construction, and has already provided an institutional guarantee and a legal foundation for jointly developing the zone and revitalizing it.
					
					They said that the exhibition would provide a good opportunity to promote the friendship and solidarity among countries and conduct multi-faceted economic trade and show of products and scientific and technological exchange.
					
					At the end of the ceremony, the participants looked round machine equipment, steel products, electrical and electronic goods, light industrial products, food, daily necessities, medicines, building materials, chemical goods, vehicles, etc. displayed by at least 120 companies from different countries and regions including the DPRK, China, Russia, Germany, the U.S., Japan and Taipei of China.
					
					A reception was given in connection with the opening of the exhibition that day.

articles.title: New Zealand Motorcyclists' Group to Tour Mt. Paektu and Mt. Halla Starts
articles.content:
New Zealand Motorcyclists' Group to Tour Mt. Paektu and Mt. Halla Starts
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A New Zealand Motorcyclists' group to tour Mt. Paektu and Mt. Halla held a kick-off ceremony on the top of Mt. Paektu on Monday.
					Present at the ceremony were Pak Kyong Il, chairman of the DPRK-New Zealand Friendship Association, officials concerned, members of the group and lecturers in revolutionary sites in the area of Mt. Paektu.
					
					The head of the group referred to the pleasure of the group to make a trip from Mt. Paektu to Mt. Halla that is up to the southernmost tip of Korea, along the great Paektu Ranges by motorcycle.
					
					He noted that the great Paektu Ranges symbolize the national reunification and homogeneity of the Korean nation as they stretch from Mt. Paektu to the end of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					It is the hope of the group to see the Korean people freely travel from Mt. Paektu to Mt. Halla in a reunified country, he added.
					
					He sincerely wished the Korean people a peaceful, harmonious and prosperous life, reiterating his will to exert great efforts for the reunification of Korea in the future, too.
					
					At the end of the ceremony, the group left Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: New Zealand Motorcyclists' Group to Tour Mt. Paektu and Mt. Halla Visits Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
New Zealand Motorcyclists' Group to Tour Mt. Paektu and Mt. Halla Visits Area of Mt. Paektu
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A New Zealand motorcyclists' group to tour Mt. Paektu and Mt. Halla visited the area of Mt. Paektu on Sunday and Monday.
					The members of the group placed bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on the shore of Lake Samji and the mosaic depicting the three commanders of Mt. Paektu in the secret camp on Mt. Paektu and paid respects to them.
					
					They visited the birthplace of leader Kim Jong Il in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu.
					
					After being briefed on the fact that born as a son of the guerrilla, he grew up, hearing the gun reports during the anti-Japanese war as a lullaby, they went round the historic relics preserved there with good care.
					
					They also looked round the Samjiyon Grand Monument standing against the background of Mt. Paektu, group sculptures of subsidiary themes and the revolutionary relics on the shore of Lake Samji.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful at 2nd Asian Youth Games
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful at 2nd Asian Youth Games
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK players are registering successes at the Second Asian Youth Games every day.
					Kim Jin A trounced her south Korean rival in the finals of the women's 52 kg category judo event on Sunday, bagging a gold medal.
					
					Kim Chol Gwang placed third at the men's 66 kg category judo event and Ri Hyon Ju in the men's 10 m platform diving event on the same day, both harvesting bronze medals.

articles.title: DPRK Players Successful at 2nd Asian Youth Games
articles.content:
DPRK Players Successful at 2nd Asian Juvenile Games
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK players have proved successful at the Second Asian Juvenile Games now under way in Nanjing of China. 
					The games, which started on August 16 and will last till August 24, brought together more than 2 000 players from 45 countries and regions including the DPRK, China, Malaysia, Thailand, Uzbekistan, Indonesia and Japan. 
					
					DPRK player O Son Hui came first in women's 44kg judo event while another player Song Nam Hyang placed first in women's 10 meter platform diving. 
					
					DPRK weightlifter Ri Chong Song bagged a gold medal by lifting a total of 253kg in men's 62kg category.

articles.title: Men's Premier Soccer League Matches Go On
articles.content:
Men's Premier Soccer League Matches Go On
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The men's premier soccer league matches to celebrate the Youth Day is going on at Kim Il Sung Stadium.
					There were matches between the Team of Ministry of Light Industry and the Wolmido Team, between the Rimyongsu Team and the Amnokgang Team, between the Sonbong Team and the Kigwancha Team, between the April 25 Team and the Mangyongbong Team and between the Hwaebul Team and the Myohyangsan Team on Sunday and Monday.
					
					In matches on Sunday the Team of the Ministry of Light Industry beat its rival 4:2, the Rimyongsu Team beat its rival 2:1 and the Sonbong Team defeated its rival 2:0.
					
					In Monday's matches the Hwaebul Team smashed its rival 3:0 and the April 25 Team won its rival 2:1.
					
					The matches go on.

articles.title: 9.5 Million Visited Oun Revolutionary Site for 30 Odd Years
articles.content:
9.5 Million Visited Oun Revolutionary Site for 30 Odd Years
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Oun Revolutionary Site is visited by an endless stream of service personnel and people on the occasion of the Day of Songun. The site is associated with the undying exploits of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, Juche 49 (1960) as the first step of his Songun revolutionary leadership. This day is significantly celebrated as the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					
					The Oun Revolutionary Site is a meaning place where Kim Jong Il conducted original ideological, theoretical and military activities from August 20 to October 4, Juche 51 (1962) when he was conducting revolutionary activities at Kim Il Sung University.
					
					Preserved at the site in their original state are the barrack where he stayed, the political department office of battalion, tunnel, several drilling grounds and other relics and data.
					
					More than 9.5 million people including service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, people, youth and students visited the site for over three decades.
					
					The number of visitors totaled more than 130,000 this year alone.

articles.title: Number of Weavers Who Carried out Yearly Plan on Increase
articles.content:
Number of Weavers Who Carried out Yearly Plan on Increase
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- More than 250 weavers have fulfilled national economic plans as of early August in factories in the field of textile industry in the DPRK.
					Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Textile Mill drew on rational machine circulating method and thread-linking method and conducted socialist emulation drive for increased production among work-teams and as a result, more than 90 fulfilled their yearly national economic plans.
					
					Over 20 workers of the Sinuiju Textile Mill brought all equipment into full-capacity operation from early this year, ranking themselves among those who fulfilled the yearly national economic plans.
					
					The September Textile Mill recorded 18 weavers who fulfilled the yearly national economic plans and other factories in the textile field including the Sariwon Textile Mill, the Kusong Textile Mill and the Hamhung Woolen Mill also produced a number of those who fulfilled national economic plans. They are effecting innovation in their work.
					
					Amid the dynamic efforts for socialist emulation drive for increased production among factories, shops and work-teams, the number of those who fulfilled the yearly national economic plans is on the steady increase in the textile industrial field.

articles.title: New Kinds of Iodine Medicines Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kinds of Iodine Medicines Developed in DPRK
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- New kinds of organoiodine medicines -- lipiodol capsule and lipiodol tablet -- were developed in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					Made from oil of sea mollusk, the capsule helps prevent and cure thyroid diseases.
					
					In this regard, KCNA met Ko Un Hyang, a doctor of the hospital of Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					She said:
					
					Lipiodol capsule is 2.5 times higher than existing iodine medicines in absorption rate and efficacy.
					
					It was proved that the cure rate of thyroid diseases is over 95.
					
					Lipiodol tablet prevents different kinds of diseases developed for lack of iodine, helping people develop their physical strength.
					
					The medicines obtained national patent and invention rights.

articles.title: Construction of Chosan Youth Power Station No. 2 Progresses Apace
articles.content:
Construction of Chosan Youth Power Station No. 2 Progresses Apace
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The construction of Chosan Youth Power Station No. 2 in Jagang Province is progressing at a final phase.
					Youth shock brigade members completed the project for driving the waterway tunnel extending hundreds of meters in a matter of three months, making a breakthrough towards increasing the speed of the construction.
					
					Efforts were focused on the dam project to carry out a huge work for dam building and lay more than 20 000 square meters of feldspar ahead of schedule.
					
					The builders of the generator room overfulfilled their daily quotas by learning from the indomitable spirit and work style of the soldier-builders in the construction site of the ski resort on Masik Pass. As a result, they removed at least 30 000 cubic meters of earth and finished the project of the structure.
					
					A high speed was created at the construction sites of the drain and spillway, opening a prospect of winding up the project ahead of schedule.
					
					A dynamic drive is now being made by the builders to assemble equipment, test them, establish an automatic control system and level the area around the power station in order to supply as early as possible electricity necessary for improving the standard of people's living and stepping up economic construction.

articles.title: Watchwords Reflecting Era Spur Building of Thriving Nation
articles.content:
Watchwords Reflecting Era Spur Building of Thriving Nation
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The great Kim Jong Un's era pulsating with the mounting revolutionary spirit sees the production of lots of watchwords reflecting the era. The country is making dynamic advance in another 100 years of the Juche era for the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					Kim Jong Il's patriotism which supreme leader Kim Jong Un glorified all over the world is a watchword reflecting the era. It shows the strong desire and iron will of the Workers' Party of Korea and the service personnel and the people to build without fail a thriving nation of Juche in which the high intention and desire of leader Kim Jong Il have come true.
					
					"Speed on Masik Pass", another watchword reflective of the era created in the construction site of the ski resort on Masik Pass, represents the stamina of Songun Korea. This flame has led to the creation of such ones as "speed on Sepho tideland", "speed in Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex", "speed in Songjin Steel Complex" and "speed in Kangson Steel Complex".
					
					Popular policies enforced by the party and the state and modern buildings convey the great solicitude of the WPK along with such watchwords as "the people-first doctrine", "conveniences before aesthetic aspect". "Giving top priority to the interests and conveniences of the people", "unbeaten snowy path" and "supply service is exactly a drive for defending socialism" and other watchwords have become the maxim of the life and struggle of the officials resolved to make the loving care of the WPK for the people pervade the big socialist family rallied in single mind.
					
					"Sea of apple trees at the foot of Chol Pass", "hand in hand and shoulder by shoulder", "Big laughter under socialism", "highly civilized socialist nation" and many other watchwords reflect the stirring reality of the country dynamically stepping up the building of a thriving nation.
					
					"Forward toward Final Victory!" declared by Kim Jong Un at the square where a military parade was held in celebration of the Day of the Sun last year resounds aloud in the general advance of the army and people, demonstrating the will of Kim Il Sung's Korea confident of the might of Korea and the future of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Peaceful Environment Is Prerequisite for Nation's Prosperity: News Analyst
articles.content:
Peaceful Environment Is Prerequisite for Nation's Prosperity: News Analyst
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Korean people are making all-out charge for the building of a thriving socialist nation with immense pride and self-esteem of having celebrated the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War as the grand festival of victors.
					Peaceful environment is valuable for the Korean people who are working hard for the building of a thriving nation and the improvement of the people's living standard, regarding them as the general goal.
					
					The lasting peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula are the cherished desire of the Korean nation.
					
					No nation has craved for peace and stability so much as the Korean nation which has had its cradle of life being reduced to the theatre of scramble by outside invaders. 
					
					The aggression and war imposed by the two imperialist powers, U.S. and Japan, in the last century seriously stymied the normal progress of economy for high civilization and undermined its foundation.
					
					The Korean people who began the creation of new society and a new life with the joy of liberation of Korea had to start from scratch again after everything was ravaged by the 3-year Korean war ignited by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					The danger of war that constantly lingered the Korean Peninsula for decades after the war had tremendous impact on the peaceful socialist construction and the improvement of people's living standard in the DPRK.
					
					The division of the territory and the nation by outsiders hampered the prosperity and development common to the nation, in particular.
					
					That's why the DPRK government and people have made every possible effort to achieve the national reconciliation, unity and reunification, the cherished desire of the fellow countrymen, and to ensure durable peace on the peninsula.
					
					The lasting peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula can be guaranteed only by the joint efforts of the Korean nation responsible for them.
					
					The results of the recent working-level talks between authorities of the north and the south for the normalization of operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone taught precious experience that all the problems can be settled in relations between the north and the south when the demand and interests common to the nation are put above all and everything is subordinated to them.
					
					All the Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should turn out to achieve the reunification of the country and ensure peace on the peninsula, bearing deep in mind that they are the driving force for achieving them.
					
					Everything should be subordinated to creating peaceful environment for reconciliation, unity and reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself".
					
					Joint nationwide efforts should be exerted to counter any act of escalating tensions on the peninsula.
					
					Ensuring peaceful environment on the peninsula is a precondition for guaranteeing the common progress and prosperity of not only Koreans but other Asians.
					
					The relevant countries responsible for the division of Korea should make positive contribution to realizing the national reconciliation, unity and reunification and ensuring lasting peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					Those who truly stand for peace on the peninsula should make a bold decision to end at an early date the state of armistice which means the state of a technical war.
					
					Peace agreement should be concluded as early as possible between parties concerned to establish a lasting peace mechanism on the peninsula.
					
					Lately the DPRK took crucial and practical measures out of broad magnanimity as evidenced by the special statement by the spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea to meet the expectation and desire of the public at home and abroad for detente on the peninsula. It was possible thanks to the desire of the DPRK to open up a new phase for reconciliation, cooperation, peace, reunification and prosperity by improving the north-south ties.
					
					The DPRK government and people will as ever make all efforts to ensure peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					Consistent and steadfast is the will of the DPRK to ensure peace on the peninsula and achieve prosperity common to the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Japanese Right-wing Politicians' Group Visit to Yasukuni Shrine
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Japanese Right-wing Politicians' Group Visit to Yasukuni Shrine
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun in a commentary on Monday blasts Dietmen belonging to the "Dietmen's Council for Calling on Everybody to Visit Yasukuni Shrine," an ultra-right organization of Japan, for flocking to the shrine and burning incense on August 15, calling back the departed soul of militarists. 
					This is a dangerous move to revive militarism as it is an open negation of the Japanese imperialists' history of aggression, the commentary notes.
					
					Laying bare the purpose of their visit to the shrine, it goes on:
					
					By making it a tradition to visit the shrine as regular event they seek to paint the war criminals as "heroes" and "patriots" and thus infuse the militarist idea deep into the minds of the Japanese. This is, in essence, nothing but an attempt to bring back those days when the Japanese imperialists dominated Asia, talking about "the Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere" in the last century. 
					
					It is their calculation that when the war criminals are praised, people will idolize and follow them and, consequently, revanchism will prevail in society. That is why they stage such farces as visits to the shrine on every anniversary and pray for the soul of the dead, describing the death of the war criminals as "sacrifices for peace and prosperity of Asia and Japan". 
					
					It is the basic objective of the Japanese reactionaries to urge not only a limited number of Japanese but all of them to visit the shrine, prepare them as diehard militarists and hurl them into overseas aggression. To this end the above-said politicians of Japan visited the shrine despite protest and condemnation of the world community.
					
					The above-said facts show no one can vouch that the Japanese equipped with such militarist idea will not go out for repeating the crime-woven history.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Assails Japan's Militarization Moves
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Assails Japan's Militarization Moves
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People carried an editorial denouncing Japan's moves for reviving militarism that bring the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula.
					The editorial recalled the visit to Yasukuni Shrine paid by high-ranking officials and more than 90 Dietmen of Japan on August 15.
					
					Arousing growing concerns are the moves for reviving militarism on the part of the defeated nation Japan, the editorial said.
					
					It added that now in progress in Japan are the moves to revise constitution for the reorganization of the "Self-Defense Forces" into the national defence forces and for bestowing them with the ability for carrying out military operations in case of contingency. 
					
					The call for revising the pacifist constitution in secret as Nazi Germany did brought to light the true nature of the Japanese government, the editorial noted, adding:
					
					More serious is that the U.S. is abetting Japan's militarization to meet its own interests.
					
					Japan's renewed militarization moves pose constant threats to the Korean Peninsula that has suffered from lingering danger of war.

articles.title: S. Korean Broadcasting Censures Japan's Moves to Distort Korea's Symbolic Song
articles.content:
S. Korean Broadcasting Censures Japan's Moves to Distort Korea's Symbolic Song
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists distorted even "Arirang", a song well known as the symbol of the Korean nation, to exterminate the nation, according to KBS of south Korea on August 14.
					The broadcasting said Japan systematically distorted the lyrics of the song to use it as a means for creating the atmosphere for annexation even before the fabrication of the "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty".
					
					The lyrics of the song carried by a photo album released by a Japanese institution in 1905 said that Koreans should agree on annexation as even such a big country as Russia failed in the war.
					
					A book written earlier by a Japanese man, Kenjo Okita, also seriously distorted the song.
					
					This was aimed to implant inferiority and the sense of defeat in the minds of the Koreans and dampen their resistance against the Japanese imperialists, the broadcasting added.
					
					It stressed that the distortion of the song with the wide use of intellectuals points to the intensity of Japan's bid to exterminate the Korean nation.

articles.title: Impressions of DPRK Given by Foreign Visitors
articles.content:
Impressions of DPRK Given by Foreign Visitors
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Stirring realities in which the building of a highly civilized socialist nation is making rapid progress thanks to the drive for gigantic creation and change are evoking a lively response among foreign visitors to the DPRK. 
					Famoi Beavogui, general director of the Agronomics Research of the Ministry of Agriculture of Guinea, said:
					
					The DPRK where all people enjoy a worthwhile life as masters of society is the genuine people's country. Magnificent buildings for people are springing up in different parts of the country and new good apartment houses are provided to working people free of charge. 
					
					I am confident that the Korean people will enjoy greater prosperity as they are stepping up the building of a thriving nation in sky-high spirits, rallied close around their leader.
					
					Julien Huck, secretary general of the International Union of Agricultural and Foodstuff Workers, said he came to know better about the DPRK while staying in it. He went on to say:
					
					Everything serves the people and they are responsible for everything--this is the reality of the DPRK. Herein lies one of secrets that Korean socialism is winning victory after victory.
					
					Javed Ahmed Ansari, secretary general of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan, said he was deeply impressed to visit the Rungna Dolphinarium, adding: Many people visit it. The Korean people who enjoy a happy life under the care of the state are the happiest in the world.
					
					The head of the delegation of a French company said:
					
					Everything is stable in the DPRK and all its people are doing worthwhile labor full of vigor.
					
					Kiichi Tsunoda, co-representative of the Gunma Prefectural Council for Japan-Korea Friendship and Solidarity, said that he could feel the pulsating breath while going round different places of Pyongyang. He noted he came to know that the state policies to bring bigger happiness to the working people are becoming realities.
					
					He wished the Korean people many successes in different fields by remaining loyal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked Koreans in Kyrgyzstan
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Kyrgyzstan held an event at the Korean Center on August 15, the 68th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					Chairman Pak Kyong Ho and officials of the Confederation and other Koreans attended.
					
					They offered a floral basket and flowers to portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid respects.
					
					Pak Kyong Ho in a speech said that thanks to the wise guidance of the President the Japanese imperialists were defeated and the historic cause of Korea's liberation was achieved on August 15, 1945.
					
					Korea, which once suffered an eclipse on the world map, emerged as an independent and sovereign state and the Korean people as masters of the full-fledged sovereign state, he added.
					
					Peaceful environment in the DPRK is essential for building a thriving nation, he stressed.
					
					Today the homeland is striving for friendship and solidarity with the world progressive people holding high the banner of independence, friendship and peace, he said, stressing that a shortcut to national prosperity and reunification lies in implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					The participants looked round photos documenting the Songun leadership feats of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					Then there took place an art performance and a dancing party.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Koreans in Uzbekistan
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- An event took place by Koreans in Uzbekistan on August 15, the 68th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					Kim Chil Song, first vice-chairman of the International United Confederation of Koreans, Ju Yong Il, chairman of the "Old Men" Association for Korean Cultural Tradition in Uzbekistan, Ko Tae Chun, its vice-chairman, and heads of various Koreans' art troupes and other Koreans were present.
					
					Ju Yong Il in a speech said that the Korean people mark the 68th anniversary of the defeat of the Japanese imperialists and liberation of the nation under the leadership of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung.
					
					He went on:
					
					Korea's liberation ended the harsh colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists and brought genuine freedom and happiness to the Korean nation. This was a historic event which made our homeland a full-fledged independent and sovereign state.
					
					Today the DPRK is strengthening friendship and solidarity with the world progressives while pursuing peace-loving policy. It is achieving great successes in building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					The future of the DPRK is bright and a rosy future is in store for building a thriving nation and reunifying the country as the Korean people are led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					There will be nothing impossible for the Koreans when they advance under the banner of "By our nation itself", the speaker said, calling for turning out for the reunification and prosperity of the country under the uplifted banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					Then there was an art performance by Korean artistes.

articles.title: DPRK's War Victory Day Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's War Victory Day Celebrated Abroad
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- World progressive people significantly celebrated the 60th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Fatherland Liberation War as their common holiday. 
					Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received gifts from state, government, political party leaders and personages of different countries including the presidents of Uganda, Namibia and Zambia, the Bangladeshi government, Workers' World Party of the United States of America, National Democratic Party of Mongolia, Islamic Coalition Party of Iran and the chairman of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar. 
					
					Kim Jong Un was awarded gold order "Star of International Friendship" by the Germany-Ukraine Centre. 
					
					A co-chairman of the Council of the Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation, chief secretary of China Hong Kong Zhonghwa Energy Fund Commission, chairwoman of the Party for Peace ad Unity of Russia, chairman of the Moscow War Veterans' Committee, president of the Khmer Democratic Party of Cambodia, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), general chairman of the Central Directive Council of the Indonesian Democratic Party of Struggle, president of the Bangladesh People's League, chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association and other personages paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions in those countries and sent there floral baskets. 
					
					A book "Rays of Great Victory" was published in Russia. 
					
					A Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia exhibition and Korean fine art exhibition took place in China, a national seminar in India and a national meeting in Peru and an Asia-Pacific regional internet seminar was held. Such events took place in more than 100 countries and regions. 
					
					Colorful events were significantly held under the sponsorship of the preparatory committees for celebrating the anniversary, governments, political parties and organizations of different countries and international and regional bodies. At the events personages of different social standings praised the exploits Generalissimo Kim Il Sung performed by winning the victory in the war and the Songun revolutionary exploits of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il. 
					
					Foreign political parties and organizations including the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, Communist Party of Argentina, Romanian Socialist Union, National Salvation Front of Russia and the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association released statements and bulletins and posted articles on their websites in praise of the undying exploits of Kim Il Sung. 
					
					At least 200 media of different countries including the China Hong Kong magazine International Link, Russian newspaper Veteran, Indian newspaper New Delhi Times, Pakistani newspaper Baluchistan Times, DR Congo newspaper La Prosperite, Uruguayan paper La Juventud and the Ecuadorian TV broadcasting service carried special write-ups or aired special programs. 
					
					They highly praised Kim Il Sung for working unprecedented military miracles, saying that he saw through the enemies' attempts with far-sighted wisdom and created superb strategy, tactics and war methods during the Fatherland Liberation War. 
					
					Citing concrete historical facts proving that the U.S. ignited the Korean War and suffered an inevitable defeat, they stressed the significance of the war victory of the DPRK army and people in the world history. 
					
					Under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un the army and people of the DPRK will glorify forever the history and tradition of sure victory and surely build a thriving socialist nation, they added.

articles.title: Polish Organization Supports DPRK's Stand to Warm Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Polish Organization Supports DPRK's Stand to Warm Inter-Korean Relations
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Polish branch of the Korean Friendship Association posted articles titled "It is the Korean people's consistent stand to improve north-south relations" and "Korean people require peaceful environment" on its internet website on August 14 to mark the 68th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					The articles said that the division of Korea and the north-south confrontation are the products of outside forces' policy of aggression. 
					
					The historical lesson teaches that the north-south confrontation will bring continued division and war only, the articles said, and went on:
					
					Mending the north-south relations is a prerequisite to ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula, uniform development and co-prosperity of the Korean people. 
					
					The Korean people have maintained a consistent stand to improve the north-south relations and achieve peace and prosperity through dialogue and cooperation and striven hard to achieve the historic cause of national reunification by concerted efforts of the nation. 
					
					Peace is the common desire of the world people for independent life and development and the greatest idea universally accepted. 
					
					It is the desire of the Korean people to lead an independent and creative life in a peaceful environment. To this end, they put forward constructive proposals for detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula and made strenuous efforts for implementing them despite persistent provocations of the imperialists.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Organization Marks Korea's Liberation Day
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Organization Marks Korea's Liberation Day
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy issued a bulletin on Aug. 10 to mark the 68th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					The bulletin in an article titled "Legendary guerilla" said that the anti-Japanese armed struggle organized by President Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea, to liberate Korea was a legendary guerrilla struggle unprecedented in the world history. 
					
					The President waged a 15-year-long guerrilla struggle without any rear or assistance from a regular army, it said, and went on:
					
					He put forward a line on achieving the liberation of the country by the efforts of Koreans with arms in reliance on the popular masses, without depending on help from other countries. 
					
					He founded the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army on April 25, 1932 and won victory after victory in the struggle against the formidable Japanese imperialists by applying preeminent strategy and tactics, thereby achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation on August 15, 1945. 
					
					The personality of Kim Il Sung as a legendary guerrilla commander will go down in history.

articles.title: Korea's Liberation Day Marked in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Korea's Liberation Day Marked in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Lectures and film shows took place in Serbia, Benin and Nigeria on Aug. 12 and 13 to mark the 68th anniversary of the liberation of Korea. 
					Participants in the film shows watched "Korea Emerged from the Ruins" and other Korean films.
					
					Batric Miyovic, general secretary of the New Yugoslavia Communist Party of Serbia, said that President Kim Il Sung led to victory the protracted anti-Japanese armed struggle without any rear or assistance from a regular army, thus achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation.
					
					Kim Il Sung saved the Korean nation from the fate of colonial slavery and set a good example in the national liberation struggle, the general secretary noted, adding that his immortal exploits would go down in the modern history of Korea and the history of the world revolutionary movement.  
					
					Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that Kim Il Sung achieved the historic cause of national liberation through his Songun leadership. Thanks to his leadership the struggle of the Korean people against the Japanese imperialists could be confidently waged along the right road, the chairman stressed.
					
					Prof. Usman Abu Tom at Nasarawa University of Nigeria praised Kim Il Sung for defeating the formidable Japanese imperialists with his unique strategy and tactics and superb war methods.

articles.title: CRPP se refiere al tema relativo a reanudacion de turismo al monte Kumgang
articles.content:
CRPP se refiere al tema relativo a reanudacion de turismo al monte Kumgang
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria (CRPP) hizo publica la vispera una declaracion que sigue:
					Como trascendidos, las conversaciones de trabajo entre autoridades del Norte y el Sur de Corea para normalizar la operacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong, que vinieron efectuandose varias veces en medio de la gran atencion interna y externa, quedaron resueltas dramaticamente en visperas del 68o  aniversario de la liberacion de Corea (15 de agosto) y se aprobo un acuerdo, los cuales infundieron alegria y esperanza a todos los connacionales y demostraron a todo el mundo la voluntad por la reunificacion y la fuerza potencial de la nacion coreana.
					
					La aprobacion del presente acuerdo deviene un resultado del unanime deseo y el apoyo activo de todos los connacionales que aspiran a la reconciliacion, la unidad, la paz, la reunificacion y prosperidad.
					
					Con el asentimiento del acuerdo, la ZIK que se hallaba en peligro, llego a tomar el camino del nuevo desarrollo con su operacion normal, lo que influye positivamente tambien al  desarrollo de relaciones intercoreanas en general y a la situacion de regiones perifericas.
					
					Por eso, todos los coreanos en el Norte y el Sur y el resto del mundo aplauden la aprobacion del presente acuerdo y desean con sinceridad que se logre otro gran avance en las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					En la nota especial del portavoz del CRPP fechada 6 de junio y la de aviso enviada el 10 del mes expirado a la parte surena propusimos reanudar el turismo al monte Kumgang y sostener con motivo de Chusok (15 de agosto lunar) el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados simultaneamente con las conversaciones de trabajo de la ZIK.
					
					Esta vez, a traves de las "palabras de felicitacion del 15 de agosto", la parte Sur propuso organizar el encuentro arriba citado en ocasion de Chusok y tambien hizo llegar una carta de aviso sobre el respecto por via de enlace de la cruz roja en Phanmunjom.
					
					Ahora se alzan en el suelo surcoreano las voces en demanda de la reanudacion de ese turismo junto con el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados y tambien los partidos opositores inclusive el "Partido Democratico" y hasta el "Partido Saenuri" en el poder insisten en su reanudacion.
					
					La ZIK y el turismo al monte Kumgang siendo simbolo de la reconciliacion y la unidad, la reunificacion y prosperidad constituyen la preciosa labor impostergable de la nacion conjunta.
					
					El turismo al monte Kumgang debe ser reanudado hoy en dia cuando va resolviendose el problema de la ZIK, lo que sera positivo tambien a las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Ahora es el momento en que el Norte y el Sur deben esforzarse conjuntamente para la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas, la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y la prosperidad conjunta.
					
					Partiendo de su invariable posicion de llevar adelante las relaciones intercoreanas conforme al ambiente conmovedor en que la ZIK tomo el camino de normalizacion y a la demanda de todos los connacionales incluyendo los diversos estratos surcoreanos y la expectativa de las opiniones internas y externas, y de abrir la nueva fase de la paz, la reunificacion y la prosperidad, el CRPP aclara bajo la autorizacion las siguientes propuestas:
					
					1. Con motivo de Chusok venidero se sostendra en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de familiares y parientes separados y se organizara tele-encuentro en ocasion del dia de la publicacion de la Declaracion del 4 de Octubre.
					
					Para ese fin, las conversaciones de trabajo de la cruz roja del Norte y el Sur tendran lugar el dia 23 segun la propuesta de la parte surena y su sede sera el monte Kumgang. Durante el tiempo de las conversaciones los participantes podran recorrer salon de visitas y tomar en el terreno las medidas para su uso.
					
					2. Se organizaran las conversaciones de trabajo entre autoridades intercoreanas para reanudar el turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					En las ocasiones se debatiran y se resolveran integralmente los problemas interesados por la parte Sur tales como los asuntos de prevenir la repeticion del caso de turista, la seguridad personal  y los bienes.
					
					Proponemos sostenerlas el dia 22 en el monte Kumgang.
					
					La reanudacion del turismo al monte Kumgang despues de la normalizacion de la ZIK ofrecera otro gran jubilo a todos los connacionales.
					
					3. Se activaran las labores para lograr la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y la prosperidad comun de la nacion.
					
					Se intensificaran los lazos fraternales entre el Norte y el Sur al realizarse activamente en varios dominios todos trabajos para la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion, la paz y la reunificacion del pais.
					
					Cuando se lleven a feliz termino nuestras propuestas arriba citadas, las relaciones intercoreanas lograran otro gran avance, se fomentara mas la confianza entre ambas partes coreanas y se adelantara la reunificacion.
					
					Es invariable la posicion de la parte Norte de lograr la paz, la reunificacion y la prosperidad comun al mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					No habra los problemas pendientes entre el Norte y el Sur cuando ambas partes se esfuercen con toda sinceridad apoyandose en la comprension mutua y el espiritu de confianza demostrados en las presentes conversaciones para normalizar la operacion de la ZIK.
					
					Estamos seguros de que las autoridades surcoreanas respondan con mucho gusto a nuestras propuestas que reflejan la demanda de todos los connacionales y la esperanza de las opiniones internas y externas.

articles.title: Presidente de Benin se reune con delegacion gubernamental de RPDC
articles.content:
Presidente de Benin se reune con delegacion gubernamental de RPDC
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- Thomas Boni Yayi, presidente de la Republica de Benin, se reunio el dia 16 en el Palacio Presidencial con la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dirigida por el canciller Pak Ui Chun, de visita en ese pais, y departio con ella en un ambiente amistoso.
					En la ocasion, el mandatario africano dijo que su pueblo no olvidara jamas el hecho de que el Presidente Kim Il Sung, gran lider del pueblo coreano, haya enviado apoyo desinteresado y cooperacion para el desarrollo socioeconomico de Benin.
					
					Las relaciones entre Benin y la RPDC son las magnificas de amistad y colaboracion con larga historia y tradicion, senalo y prosiguio que intensificara la cooperacion en varios sectores en el principio de beneficio mutuo estrechando las relaciones con el pueblo coreano.
					
					Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion el ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, Integracion Africana, Paises Francofonos y Compatriotas en Ultramar, el asesor de diplomacia de la presidencia, las personalidades interesadas y el embajador coreano en el pais africano.

articles.title: Llega a Congo Democratico delegacion gubernamental de RPDC
articles.content:
Llega a Congo Democratico delegacion gubernamental de RPDC
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- La delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por el canciller Pak Ui Chun llego el dia 17 a Kinshasa para realizar una visita a la Republica Democratica de Congo.
					La recibieron en el aeropuerto el ministro interino de Asuntos Exteriores, Cooperacion y Asuntos de Francofonia y otras personalidades, asi como el embajador coreano en ese pais.
					
					Por otra parte, la delegacion salio el mismo dia de Cotonou por via aerea tras concluir la visita a la Republica de Benin.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al electo presidente maliense
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al electo presidente maliense
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 17 un mensaje de felicitacion al electo presidente de la Republica de Mali, Ibrahim Boubacar Keita.
					En la misiva, el remitente hace votos sinceros por los exitos en el trabajo responsable del destinatario por la estabilidad y el desarrollo economico del pais y el bienestar del pueblo.
					
					Y expresa la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran sin cesar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Mali que tienen larga tradicion historica.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun departe con Nassirou Arifari Bako
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun departe con Nassirou Arifari Bako
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 16 en Cotonou las conversaciones entre Pak Ui Chun, ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y Nassirou Arifari Bako, ministro de Asuntos Exteriores, Integracion Africana, Paises Francofonos y Compatriotas en Ultramar de Benin.
					Tomaron parte en la ocasion los integrantes de la delegacion gubernamental coreana, de visita en Benin, y el embajador coreano en el pais africano por la parte coreana y por la otra, el director de Asia del Ministerio de Asuntos Exteriores, Integracion Africana, Paises Francofonos y Compatriotas en Ultramar.
					
					Ambas partes avisaron la situacion de respectivos paises e intercambiaron los criterios sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre dos paises y otros problemas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Inaugurada III Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason
articles.content:
Inaugurada III Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 19 en la ciudad de Rason la III Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason.
					Los participantes en el acto rindieron homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il tras colocar un cesto de flores ante las imagenes de estos grandes hombres establecidas en la Exposicion Permanente de Rason. 
					
					En la ocasion participaron el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Rason y del comite organizador del presente certamen, Jo Jong Ho, y otros funcionarios, los de la citada ciudad, delegados y exponentes de varios paises y regiones y los empresarios extranjeros en la Zona Economica y Comercial de Rason. 
					
					Hubo discursos de inauguracion y de felicitacion. 
					
					Los oradores se refirieron a que en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se impulsa activamente la construccion economica y estan preparados la garantia institucional y el fundamento juridico para asegurar el desarrollo conjunto y la activacion de la Zona Economica y Comercial de Rason. 
					
					Apuntaron que el presente certamen sera un buen motivo para fomentar la amistad y solidaridad entre los paises, activar las transacciones economicas y comerciales multifaceticos, la presentacion de mercancias, el intercambio de ciencias y tecnicas, etc. 
					
					Terminado el acto, los participantes recorrieron las maquinas, los articulos de acero, los electricos y electronicos, los de industria ligera, los alimentos, los articulos de uso diario, las medicinas, los materiales de construccion, los productos quimicos y los medios de transporte expuestos por mas de 120 unidades de varios paises  y regiones, entre otros, la RPDC, China, Rusia, Alemania, Estados Unidos, Japon y Taipei  China.
					
					Este dia, se ofrecio un banquete en honor de la inauguracion de la exposicion.

articles.title: Jugadores coreanos logran exitos en II campeonato asiatico de juniores
articles.content:
Jugadores coreanos logran exitos en II campeonato asiatico de juniores
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los jugadores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea logran exitos en el II campeonato asiatico de juniores.
					La judoka Kim Jin A conquisto la medalla de oro en su peso de 52 kilos venciendo a su rival surcoreana en la final efectuada el dia 18. 
					
					El mismo dia, Kim Chol Gwang y Ri Hyon Ju recibieron las medallas de bronce en la categoria de 66kg de judo (m) y en el clavado desde la plataforma fija de 10 m (m), respectivamente.

articles.title: Ambiente pacifico es condicion previa para prosperidad nacional, senala ACNC
articles.content:
Ambiente pacifico es condicion previa para prosperidad nacional, senala ACNC
Pyongyang, 19 de agosto (ACNC) -- Hoy dia, el pueblo coreano libra la ofensiva general para construir un Estado prospero socialista con el gran orgullo de haber celebrado el 60o aniversario de la victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria como gran festival de triunfadores.
					El ambiente pacifico hace mas falta que nunca a nuestro pueblo que lucha por alcanzar su meta general de construir un Estado prospero y mejorar los niveles de su vida.
					
					La paz duradera y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana son el anhelo de la nacion coreana.
					
					Nuestra nacion, cuyo terreno ha sido antes el escenario de la pugna de agresores extranjeros, desea mas que nadie la paz y la estabilidad.
					
					La agresion y la guerra de las potencias imperialistas de EE.UU. y Japon en el siglo pasado impidieron gravemente el desarrollo normal de la economia y civilizacion de la nacion coreana y destruyeron su base.
					
					El pueblo coreano, que complacido de la liberacion del pais, habia entrado en la construccion de nueva sociedad pacifica y la creacion de nueva vida, se vio obligado a comenzar de nuevo debido a la guerra coreana de 3 anos desatada por el imperialismo norteamericano, la cual devasto lo todo.
					
					El peligro de guerra, que persiste varias decadas en la Peninsula Coreana desde el fin de la guerra coreana, causo colosales danos a la construccion pacifica de socialismo y a la mejora de la vida del pueblo
					
					En particular, la division territorial y nacional impuesta por las fuerzas extranjeras impidio el camino de prosperidad y desarrollo comunes de la nacion coreana.
					
					Por lo tanto, el gobierno y el pueblo de la RPDC hicieron todo lo posible para lograr cuanto antes la reconciliacion, la unidad y la reunificacion y traer a la Peninsula Coreana la paz duradera.
					
					La paz duradera y la estabilidad pueden ser garantizadas por los esfuerzos comunes de toda la nacion coreana, autora de esos asuntos.
					
					El resultado de las recientes conversaciones de trabajo de autoridades Norte-Sur por la normalizacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong ensena la valiosa experiencia de que cuando se da prioridad y sujete lo todo a la demanda e interes comun de la nacion, es posible resolver cualquier problema entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					Todos los connacionales del Norte y el Sur de Corea y en ultramar deberan levantarse unanimemente en la lucha para lograr la reunificacion del pais y defender la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Hay que orientar lo todo a crear el ambiente pacifico por lograr la reconciliacion, la unidad y la reunificacion bajo la bandera de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					Deben enfrentarse con las fuerzas unidas a cualesquier accion que genere la tension en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Garantizar el ambiente pacifico de la Peninsula Coreana es el requisito por el desarrollo y la prosperidad comunes de la nacion coreana y las demas asiaticas.
					
					Los paises responsables de la division de Corea deben hacer contribucion positiva a realizar la reconciliacion, la unidad y la reunificacion de la nacion coreana y asegurar la paz duradera y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Si desean la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, deben tomar la decision por acabar cuanto antes con el armisticio que significa el estado tecnicamente en guerra.
					
					Hay que establecer en la Peninsula Coreana el sistema de paz duradera firmando cuanto antes el acuerdo de paz entre los paises interesados.
					
					La RPDC tomo las magnanimas, sinceras e importantes medidas como las estipuladas en la declaracion especial del vocero del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria partiendo del deseo de abrir la nueva fase de la reconciliacion, la cooperacion, la paz, la prosperidad y la reunificacion mejorando las relaciones intercoreanas conforme a la aspiracion de la opinion publica interna y externa al aflojamiento de la tension de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El gobierno y el pueblo de la RPDC haran todos los esfuerzos posibles en el futuro tambien por defender la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Es invariable y firme la voluntad de la RPDC de defender la paz de la Peninsula Coreana y lograr la prosperidad comun de la nacion.
